doc_id: ALS PR 4- Endotracheal Tube Introducer (ETTI) Procedure_APR22

pages.text:
April 2022 County of Marin EMS ALS PR 4
ENDOTRACHEAL TUBE
INTRODUCER (ETTI) PROCEDURE
Indications
• Airway structure or condition which prevents adequate visualization by standard tools of
endotracheal intubation. May include:
• Patients with Grade II through IV laryngeal views (Cormack-Lehane grade)
• Patients with airway edema regardless of laryngeal view
• Perform laryngoscopy and obtain the Equipment
best possible laryngeal view
• Holding the ETTI in your right hand and • Intubation supplies
the angled tip pointing upward, gently • ETT Introducer
advance the ETTI anteriorly (under the
epiglottis) to the glottic opening (cords)
• Gently advance the ETTI until resistance is encountered
at the carina
• NEVER force the ETTI, pharyngeal/tracheal
perforation may be caused
• If no resistance is encountered and the entire length
of the ETTI is inserted, the device is in the esophagus
• The ETTI is correctly placed when you see the device
going through the cords, when the ratcheting of the tip
on the trachea, an/or when resistance is met while
advancing the device
SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS
• Use the confirmation
methods standard for
endotracheal intubation to
• Once positioned, withdraw the ETTI until the 37cm
verify placement of the ETT
black line mark is aligned with the lip and advance an
prior to and after initiating
ETT over the ETTI and into the trachea
ventilation
• If resistance is encountered while advancing the ETT,
withdraw the ETT slightly, rotate 90º and reattempt
• Once ETT is in position, inflate cuff, then while holding
the tube, remove the ETTI through the ETT
Critical Information
• Confirm tracheal placement
• Contraindications:
• Patient fits on length
based tape
• ETT smaller than 6.0
